cab.content: Military Secret. 1307From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,30th April 1920.(Received 3rd May.)5442. 30th April. Malleson wires 26tli April, repeating Tehran: " A report received that a Bolshevik Brigade Commander with eight N.G.O.'s lias deserted from A ska bad to Bajgiran."He states that no response has been made by the Turcoman council to the Bolshevik appeals to enlist. The garrison now in Askabad number about 7,000, half of whom are unarmed recruits whose morale is generally bad. Many more desertions are inevitable on account of short food, age and general dissatisfaction. All prominent positions, civil and military, are held by Jews, which is much resented." The Bolsheviks are alarmed by rumours of Afghan designs and a general Mohamedan rising. Accounts from Moscow are disquieting and even (three corrupt groups) anticipate an outbreak against present regime in Central Russia."2. information lias also been received that artillery men and armoured cars contemplate deserting to our lines from Askabad.
